result.title: Eversource Energy Declares Common Dividend
result.text: HARTFORD, Conn. & BOSTON--(BUSINESS WIRE)--The Board of Trustees of Eversource Energy (NYSE:ES) today approved a quarterly dividend of $0.7525 per share, payable on December 31, 2025, to shareholders of record as of the close of business on December 15, 2025. Eversource (NYSE: ES), celebrated as a national leader for its corporate citizenship, is recognized as the #1 U.S. utility on TIME's List of World's Best Companies for 2024. result.title: Eversource Energy: The Self-Help Story Is Playing Out
result.text: Eversource Energy, an American utility holding company, is now a $24 billion (by market cap) diversified utility. ES's current plan calls for investing slightly more than $23 billion between 2024 and 2028. ES increased its dividend for 27 consecutive years, with a 10-year dividend growth rate of 6.2%.

result.title: Best Dividend Aristocrats For December 2025
result.text: The ProShares S&P 500 Dividend Aristocrats ETF (NOBL) has underperformed the SPDR S&P 500 ETF (SPY) year-to-date, but November shows a reversal. Several Dividend Aristocrats, including CAH, CAT, CHRW, and ALB, have posted double-digit gains in 2025, while others lag behind. result.title: Eversource Energy: Moving To Hold Due To Diminished Upside Potential
result.text: Eversource Energy offers a 4.25% dividend yield with 5%+ growth, supported by regulated operations and recent divestitures to strengthen its balance sheet. Valuation metrics show that Eversource Energy is fairly valued today, with a fair value estimate of $71. With less than 10% undervaluation + dividend yield + dividend growth, I am moving to Hold after this strong run.

result.title: Eversource Energy Provides Update on Offshore Wind Liability
result.text: HARTFORD, Conn. & BOSTON--(BUSINESS WIRE)--Eversource Energy (NYSE: ES) today announced that it has increased its liability related to expected future payments to Global Infrastructure Partners (GIP) as part of the September 30, 2024, sale of the South Fork Wind and Revolution Wind projects (collectively, the Offshore Wind Projects) by approximately $285 million.
